snippet.title: China's 2014 bird flu death toll rises to nearly 100 | South ...
snippet.description: Almost 100 people in China have died from the H7N9 bird flu strain in the first three months of the year, but the number of both fatalities and infections declined in March, government figures showed. A total of 24 people died from the disease in March, the National Health and Family Planning

snippet.title: CDC - Avian Influenza A (H7N9) Virus | Avian Influenza (Flu)
snippet.description: Human infections with a new avian influenza A (H7N9) virus were first reported in China in March 2013. Most of these infections are believed to result from exposure to infected poultry or contaminated environments, as H7N9 viruses have also been found in poultry in China.

snippet.title: Deadly bird flu surges in China as millions travel - USA TODAY
snippet.description: Deadly bird flu surges in China as millions travel. Four more cases of deadly bird flu were reported in China on Wednesday, bringing the total since Friday to 27.

snippet.title: China 2014 bird flu toll rises to nearly 100
snippet.description: Diseases, Conditions, Syndromes; April 11, 2014; China 2014 bird flu toll rises to nearly 100. Almost 100 people in China died from the H7N9 bird flu strain in the first three months of the year, but the number of both fatalities and infections declined in March, government figures showed.

snippet.title: bird flu \- chinadaily.com.cn - Chinadaily US Edition
snippet.description: Find out the latest news stories and photos on the bird flu virus from China Daily and chinadaily.com.cn.

snippet.title: H7N9 bird flu resurges in China ahead of Lunar New Year - CNN.com
snippet.description: H7N9 bird flu cases spike in China ahead of Lunar New Year, with 19 deaths and 96 humans infected in January alone, China's official Xinhua news agency says.

snippet.title: Latest Bird Flu Case Shows Japan's Vulnerability - Japan ...
snippet.description: The recent outbreak of bird flu in Japan shows that despite stricter guidelines for preventing the spread of infections, the nation still remains vulnerable to the introduction of strains of the disease from other parts of Asia. snippet.title: Bird Flu (Avian Flu): Symptoms, How You Catch It, Treatments ...
snippet.description: WebMD has been in touch with the CDC, the World Health Organization, and infectious disease experts to answer your bird flu questions.
